00045                                                _triggerConfChange(this, &TriggerHandlerCalice::ExtractTriggerEnvironment),

00115 //initialization
00116 void TriggerHandlerCalice::init() {
00117 
00118   lcio::StringVec temp_col_name_fe_conf;
00119   temp_col_name_fe_conf.push_back(COL_EMC_FE_CONF);
00120   temp_col_name_fe_conf.push_back(COL_AHC_FE_CONF);
00121   temp_col_name_fe_conf.push_back(COL_FE_CONF);
00122 
00123   lcio::StringVec temp_col_name_module_connection;
00124   temp_col_name_module_connection.push_back(string("EmcModuleConnection"));
00125   temp_col_name_module_connection.push_back(string("AhcModuleConnection"));
00126 
00127   init( string(COL_TRIGGER_ASSIGNMENT), 
00128         string(COL_TRIGGER_CHECK), 
00129         string(COL_TRIGGER_CONF), 
00130         string(COL_RO_CONF),
00131         string(COL_TRGRO_CONF),
00132         temp_col_name_fe_conf,
00133         temp_col_name_module_connection);
00134 }

00137 //initialization (collection names from external source)
00138   void TriggerHandlerCalice::init(const string& col_trigger_assignment, 
00139                                   const string& col_trigger_check, 
00140                                   const string& colBeTrgConf,
00141                                   const string& col_name_readout_conf,
00142                                   const string& col_name_trgro_conf,
00143                                   const lcio::StringVec& col_name_fe_conf, 
00144                                   const lcio::StringVec& col_name_module_connection)
00145   {
00146 
00147   //get the handlers for the desired trigger conditions data 
00148   //these names have to be given in the MARLIN steering !!!
00149   //FIXME: need to throw exceptions
00150 
00151   //needs to be initalized only once
00152   if(!_isInitialized) {
00153 
00154     if (col_name_module_connection.size() != col_name_fe_conf.size() ) {
00155       throw std::runtime_error("TriggerHandlerCalice::init> For each front-end conditions data there must be defined exactly one module connection conditions data.");
00156     }
00157 
00158     std::stringstream message;
00159     message << "TriggerConfiguration::init> No conditions data handler registered handler to listen for ";
00160 
00161     // count errors upon handler registration
00162     unsigned int cond_error=0;
00163   
00164     if (!marlin::ConditionsProcessor::registerChangeListener(&_triggerAssignment, col_trigger_assignment) ) {
00165       message  << (cond_error++>0 ? "," : "") << col_trigger_assignment;
00166     }
00167 
00168     if (!marlin::ConditionsProcessor::registerChangeListener(&_triggerConfChange, colBeTrgConf)) {
00169       message  << (cond_error++>0 ? "," : "") << colBeTrgConf;
00170     }
00171 
00172     if (!marlin::ConditionsProcessor::registerChangeListener(&_triggerCheck, col_trigger_check)) {
00173       message  << (cond_error++>0 ? "," : "") << col_trigger_check;
00174     }
00175 
00176     if (!marlin::ConditionsProcessor::registerChangeListener(&_roConfChange, col_name_readout_conf)) {
00177       message  << (cond_error++>0 ? "," : "") << col_name_readout_conf;
00178     }
00179 
00180     if(!marlin::ConditionsProcessor::registerChangeListener(&_trgroConfChange, col_name_trgro_conf)) {
00181       message  << (cond_error++>0 ? "," : "") << col_name_trgro_conf;
00182     }
00183 
00184 
00185 
00186     // to register the conditions change handlers
00187     // first all conditions change delegators need to be created.
00188     // Since they are stored in a vector, the address of the delegator objects
00189     // may change if the vector is extended. So first all delegators are created
00190     // then they are registered.
00191 
00192     unsigned int set_i=0;
00193     for (lcio::StringVec::const_iterator name_iter=col_name_fe_conf.begin();
00194          name_iter!=col_name_fe_conf.end();
00195          name_iter++, set_i++) {
00196       _feConfChange.push_back(MultipleConditionsChangeDelegator<TriggerHandlerCalice>(this,&TriggerHandlerCalice::feConfigurationChange,set_i));
00197     }
00198 
00199     set_i=0;
00200     for (lcio::StringVec::const_iterator name_iter=col_name_module_connection.begin();
00201          name_iter!=col_name_module_connection.end();
00202          name_iter++, set_i++) {
00203       _moduleConnectionChange.push_back(MultipleConditionsChangeDelegator<TriggerHandlerCalice>(this,&TriggerHandlerCalice::moduleConnectionChange,set_i));
00204     }
00205 
00206     _nFrontEnds.resize(col_name_module_connection.size());
00207     _swTriggerOnVec.resize(col_name_module_connection.size());
00208     _calibrationOnVec.resize(col_name_module_connection.size());
00209     _feConfCol.resize(col_name_module_connection.size());
00210 
00211     // listen for changes of front-end configurations
00212     {
00213       lcio::StringVec::const_iterator name_iter=col_name_fe_conf.begin();
00214       for (std::vector<CALICE::MultipleConditionsChangeDelegator<TriggerHandlerCalice> >::iterator change_delegator_iter=_feConfChange.begin();
00215            change_delegator_iter!=_feConfChange.end();
00216            change_delegator_iter++, name_iter++) {
00217 
00218         assert( name_iter != col_name_fe_conf.end() );
00219 
00220         if (!marlin::ConditionsProcessor::registerChangeListener(&(*change_delegator_iter), *name_iter)) {
00221           message  << (cond_error++>0 ? "," : "") << *name_iter;
00222         }
00223       }
00224     }
00225     
00226     // listen for changes of module connection changes
00227     {
00228       lcio::StringVec::const_iterator name_iter=col_name_module_connection.begin();
00229       for (std::vector<CALICE::MultipleConditionsChangeDelegator<TriggerHandlerCalice> >::iterator change_delegator_iter=_moduleConnectionChange.begin();
00230            change_delegator_iter!=_moduleConnectionChange.end();
00231            change_delegator_iter++, name_iter++) {
00232 
00233         assert( name_iter != col_name_module_connection.end() );
00234 
00235         if (!marlin::ConditionsProcessor::registerChangeListener(&(*change_delegator_iter), *name_iter)) {
00236           message  << (cond_error++>0 ? "," : "") << *name_iter;
00237         }
00238       }
00239     }
00240 
00241 
00242     if (cond_error>0) {
00243       message << ".";
00244       //CRP Temporary fix to to avoid memery leak caused by LCCD or CondDBMySQL
00245       //which appears if a listener is registered but no data are found
00246       //On the other hand the trigger handler did throw a runtime error
00247       //if there is a missing changelistener but if a detector missing
00248       //some record types did not appear in the datastream 
00249       //or no cd data saet was entered into the db for that period
00250       //throw std::runtime_error(message.str());
00251       std::cout << "Warning: " << message.str() << std::endl;
00252     }
00253 
00254 
00255     _isInitialized = true;
00256   }
00257 
00258 }
00259   
00260   void TriggerHandlerCalice::setTriggerEventClass() 
00261   {
00262     if (_colNameTriggerEvent == COL_TRIGGER_EVENT) {
00263       _trgEventClass=kBeTrgEvent;
00264     }
00265     else if (_colNameTriggerEvent == COL_FETRG) {
00266       _trgEventClass=kFeTrgEvent;
00267     }
00268     else {
00269       _trgEventClass=kUnknown;
00270     }
00271   }

00275 //adding the trigger information to the event
00276   void TriggerHandlerCalice::setTrigger(LCEvent* evt) {
00277 
00278     if (_trdefMap.empty()) {
00279    cout << "Event Number: " << evt->getEventNumber() << endl;   
00280    LCTime EventTime(evt->getTimeStamp());
00281    cout << "Event Time: " << EventTime.getDateString() << endl;   
00282    throw std::runtime_error("TriggerHandlerCalice::SetTrigger - No Trigger Definition found. Will leave program now!!!");
00283    }
00284 
00285 #ifdef TRIGGER_HANDLER_IS_SINGLETON
00286     //check whether the init method has already been called 
00287     //if not do it
00288     if(!_isInitialized) init();
00289 #endif
00290         
00291     PrepareTriggerEventData(evt);
00292     
00293 
00294 
00295 #ifdef RECO_DEBUG
00296     std::cout << "Last Conf Change: " << _lastConfigurationChange << std::endl; 
00297     std::cout << "Conf Change Id: " << _nConfigurationChanges << std::endl;       
00298 #endif
00299     
00300     
00301     //Set the "configured" trigger 
00302     _lastConfigurationChange = _nConfigurationChanges;
00303 
00304 
00305     _event_triggerBits.reset();
00306 
00307     // also check the trigger history in case of poll timeouts
00308 
00309 #ifdef RECO_DEBUG
00310       cout << "Size of Fifo: " << getUsedFifoDepth() << std::endl;
00311 #endif
00312     if (getUsedFifoDepth() < (unsigned) (_main_word + 1) ) {
00313 #ifdef RECO_DEBUG
00314       cout << "Runnumber: " << evt->getRunNumber() << " Eventnumber: " << evt->getEventNumber() << " Time: " << _theTime.getDateString() << endl;
00315       cout << "Number of words in fifo too small to extract Main Word" << endl;
00316       cout << "Size of Fifo: " << getUsedFifoDepth() << std::endl;
00317       cout << "Main Word at: " << _main_word << std::endl;
00318 #endif
00319     }
00320 
00321   }
00322 
00323   // search in the fifo for a word which for which the configured mask is on.
00324   // The search starts at the main word. It is performed in first 
00325   // in increasing time direction, then in decreasing time direction.
00326 
00327   unsigned int TriggerHandlerCalice::searchTriggerMainWord()
00328   {
00329       
00330     unsigned int actualMask =  _genericTriggerMask | _confTriggerMask;
00331 #ifdef RECO_DEBUG
00332     std::cout << "actual mask: " << actualMask << std::endl;    
00333     std::cout << "Default main word:" << _main_word << std::endl;
00334 #endif
00335     // \todo throw an exception ?
00336     if (actualMask == 0 ) return _main_word;
00337     
00338     unsigned int used_fifo_depth=getUsedFifoDepth();
00339     if (used_fifo_depth<2) return 0;
00340     
00341     unsigned int this_trigger_main_word  = used_fifo_depth+1;
00342     unsigned int this_trigger_off  = used_fifo_depth+1;
00343 
00344 
00345     unsigned int main_word_value=0;
00346     
00347     //search trigger main word
00348     unsigned int last_trigger_word=_main_word+abs(_word_up)+1;
00349    if (last_trigger_word>used_fifo_depth) {
00350       last_trigger_word=used_fifo_depth;
00351     }
00352     
00353     unsigned int first_trigger_word=0;
00354     if (abs(_word_down)<_main_word) {
00355       first_trigger_word=_main_word-abs(_word_down);
00356     }
00357     
00358     // search up 
00359     for (unsigned int iword=_main_word ; iword<last_trigger_word; iword++) {
00360       
00361       // allow for a jitter in one direction
00362       // \todo also in the other ?
00363       unsigned int testWord = static_cast<unsigned int>(_theTriggerFifoCont.at( iword )) | static_cast<unsigned int>(_theTriggerFifoCont.at( iword + 1 ));
00364       
00365       // \todo allow for the generic bit ?
00366       if ( (testWord & actualMask)  && (testWord & _genericTriggerMask )) {
00367         if ( ( _theTriggerFifoCont.at( iword) & actualMask) == 0 ) {
00368           //std::cout << "iword In trigger search: " << iword << std::endl;
00369           iword++;
00370         }
00371         this_trigger_main_word=iword;
00372         this_trigger_off=iword;
00373         main_word_value = testWord;
00374         
00375         // now find positions where it goes off ;
00376         for (unsigned int jword=this_trigger_main_word+1; jword < last_trigger_word; jword++) {
00377           
00378           testWord = _theTriggerFifoCont.at( jword ) | _theTriggerFifoCont.at( jword + 1 );
00379           // testWord should have still the bits enabled of the enabled trigger inputs which were enabled at the firs location
00380           if ( !(testWord & main_word_value & actualMask ) || !(testWord & _genericTriggerMask )) break;
00381           main_word_value |= testWord;
00382           this_trigger_off=jword;
00383         }
00384         
00385         if (this_trigger_main_word>0) {
00386           
00387           // now find positions where it goes on ;
00388           unsigned int start_down_search=this_trigger_main_word;
00389           if (start_down_search>0) start_down_search--;
00390           for (unsigned int jword=start_down_search; jword-->0; ) {
00391             
00392             testWord = _theTriggerFifoCont.at( jword ) | _theTriggerFifoCont.at( jword + 1 );
00393             if ( !(testWord & main_word_value & actualMask ) || !(testWord & _genericTriggerMask )) break;
00394             main_word_value |= testWord;
00395             this_trigger_main_word = jword+1;
00396           }
00397           
00398         }
00399         
00400         break;
00401       }
00402     }
00403     
00404     if (this_trigger_main_word>=last_trigger_word) {
00405       
00406       unsigned int first_trigger_word=0;
00407       if (abs(_word_down)<_main_word) {
00408         first_trigger_word=_main_word-abs(_word_down);
00409       }
00410       
00411       // search down
00412       for (unsigned int iword=_main_word ; iword-->first_trigger_word; ) {
00413         
00414         // allow for a jitter in one direction
00415         // \todo also in the other ?
00416         unsigned int testWord = static_cast<unsigned int>(_theTriggerFifoCont.at( iword )) | static_cast<unsigned int>(_theTriggerFifoCont.at( iword + 1 ));
00417         
00418         // \todo allow for or ? 
00419         if ( (testWord & actualMask)  && (testWord & _genericTriggerMask )) {
00420           this_trigger_main_word=iword;
00421           if ( ( _theTriggerFifoCont.at( iword) &  actualMask) == 0) {
00422             iword++;
00423           }
00424           this_trigger_off=iword;
00425           main_word_value = testWord;
00426           
00427           // now find positions where it goes off ;
00428           for (unsigned int jword=this_trigger_main_word+1; jword < last_trigger_word; jword++) {
00429             
00430             testWord = _theTriggerFifoCont.at( jword ) | _theTriggerFifoCont.at( jword + 1 );
00431             if ( !(testWord & main_word_value & actualMask ) || !(testWord & _genericTriggerMask )) break;
00432             main_word_value |= testWord;
00433             this_trigger_off=jword;
00434           }
00435           
00436           if (this_trigger_main_word>0) {
00437             
00438             // now find positions where it goes on ;
00439             unsigned int start_down_search=this_trigger_main_word;
00440             if (start_down_search>0) start_down_search--;
00441             for (unsigned int jword=start_down_search; jword-->0; ) {
00442               
00443               testWord = _theTriggerFifoCont.at( jword ) | _theTriggerFifoCont.at( jword + 1 );
00444               if ( !(testWord & main_word_value & actualMask ) || !(testWord & _genericTriggerMask )) break;
00445               main_word_value |= testWord;
00446               this_trigger_main_word = jword+1;
00447             }
00448             
00449           }
00450           
00451           break;
00452         }
00453         
00454       }
00455     }
00456 
00457     
00458 #ifdef RECO_DEBUG
00459     std::cout << "Found Main Word: " << this_trigger_main_word << std::endl;
00460 #endif
00461     if(this_trigger_main_word ==_theTriggerFifoCont.size()-1 || this_trigger_main_word == 0) {
00462       _this_trigger_main_word = -1;
00463       _this_trigger_length = 0;   
00464     } else {
00465       _this_trigger_main_word=static_cast<int>(this_trigger_main_word);
00466       _this_trigger_length=this_trigger_main_word-this_trigger_off;
00467     }
00468     
00469     
00470 #ifdef RECO_DEBUG
00471     std::cout << "The main word: " <<  _this_trigger_main_word << std::endl;
00472     int icount(0);
00473     if(_theTriggerFifoCont.size() > 0) {
00474       for(IntVec::iterator vec_iter = _theTriggerFifoCont.begin();vec_iter != _theTriggerFifoCont.end(); vec_iter++){
00475         std::cout << "Fifo Element at " <<  icount << " is: " << "in hex: " << std::hex << *vec_iter << std::dec << " in ";
00476         to_binary_bitops(*vec_iter);  
00477         icount++;
00478       }
00479     }
00480 #endif
00481     return _this_trigger_main_word;
00482     
00483     
00484   }
00485 
00486 
00487 //the validation check
00488 bool TriggerHandlerCalice::isValidTrigger(const LCEvent* evt) {
00489 
00490 #ifdef TRIGGER_HANDLER_IS_SINGLETON
00491    //check whether the init method has already been called 
00492    //if not do it
00493    if(!_isInitialized) init();
00494 #endif
00495 
00496    std::cout << "Warning - TriggerHandlerCalice isValidtrigger: " << std:: endl;
00497    std::cout << "The Trigger Check will maybe re-implemented in future versions. " << std::endl;
00498    std::cout << "This method will always return true" << std::endl;
00499 
00500    bool isValidTrigger = true;
00501 
00502 
00503    bool isImplemented=false;
00504    assert ( isImplemented );
00505    
00506    return isValidTrigger;
00507 }
00508 
00509 
00510   void TriggerHandlerCalice::searchTriggerHistory() {
00511 
00512   // \todo need to define the first trigger word;
00513   unsigned int first_trigger_word=0;
00514   //  if (_this_trigger_main_word > _word_down) {
00515   //    first_trigger_word = _word_down;
00516   //  }
00517 
00518   _distanceToPreTrigger.clear();
00519   _distanceToPostTrigger.clear();
00520   unsigned int dirty_triggerBits(0); 
00521   _outOfRange_triggerBits = 0;
00522   
00523 
00524   //define the maximal pulslength a bit could have been on
00525   //FIXME this has to become a steering parameter, in the extreme case
00526   //separate for each known trigger 
00527   unsigned int pulselength(2); 
00528 
00529 
00530   if (static_cast<unsigned int>(_this_trigger_main_word)>=getUsedFifoDepth()) {
00531     _outOfRange_triggerBits = getPrincipleTriggerMask();
00532     return;
00533   }
00534 
00535   unsigned int start_trigger_word=static_cast<unsigned int>(_this_trigger_main_word);
00536   unsigned int future_search_start_trigger_word=static_cast<unsigned int>(_this_trigger_main_word);
00537 
00538   unsigned int event_trigger_bits=0;
00539   if (_this_trigger_main_word>255) {
00540     _outOfRange_triggerBits=0xffffff;
00541     _event_triggerBits=0;
00542     //return _distanceToPreTrigger;
00543     return;
00544   }
00545   unsigned int out_of_range_trigger_bits =0;
00546 
00547   // find fifo word of the slowest "trigger" which should corresponds to the main word.
00548   for(TriggerDefinitionMap_t::const_iterator trdef_iter = _trdefMap.begin(); 
00549       trdef_iter != _trdefMap.end(); 
00550       ++trdef_iter) {
00551 
00552     unsigned int a_start_trigger_word;
00553     if ( trdef_iter->first.delay() < 0 && static_cast<unsigned int>(-trdef_iter->first.delay()) > static_cast<unsigned int>(_this_trigger_main_word) )  {
00554       a_start_trigger_word=0;
00555       out_of_range_trigger_bits |= trdef_iter->second.bitMask();
00556     }
00557     else {
00558       a_start_trigger_word= static_cast<unsigned int>(_this_trigger_main_word) + trdef_iter->first.delay();
00559     }
00560 
00561     if (a_start_trigger_word>=static_cast<unsigned int>(trdef_iter->first.jitter())) a_start_trigger_word -= trdef_iter->first.jitter();
00562     else a_start_trigger_word=0;
00563 
00564     if ( a_start_trigger_word >= getUsedFifoDepth()) {
00565         start_trigger_word=getUsedFifoDepth();
00566         // \todo issue error that expected trigger position outside fifo size?
00567         //      std::cout << "WARNING: Expected trigger  position of " << trdef_iter->second.name() 
00568         //                << " is outside fifo depth ." << std::endl;
00569         out_of_range_trigger_bits |= trdef_iter->second.bitMask();
00570     }
00571     else {
00572       
00573       unsigned int a_last_word = a_start_trigger_word+2*trdef_iter->first.jitter()+1;
00574       if (a_last_word > getUsedFifoDepth()) a_last_word = getUsedFifoDepth();
00575       
00576       // check the fifo around the expected position whether the bit was on or off.
00577       for (unsigned int jword=a_start_trigger_word; jword< a_last_word ; jword++) {
00578       // value should be the trigger bits corresponding to the trigger;
00579        if ( (_theTriggerFifoCont[jword] & trdef_iter->first.mask()) ) {
00580           event_trigger_bits |= trdef_iter->second.bitMask();
00581         }
00582       }
00583 
00584       if (a_start_trigger_word > start_trigger_word) {
00585         start_trigger_word= a_start_trigger_word;
00586       }
00587       if (a_last_word < future_search_start_trigger_word) {
00588         future_search_start_trigger_word= a_last_word;
00589       }
00590       
00591     }
00592 
00593 
00594   }
00595 
00596   _outOfRange_triggerBits = out_of_range_trigger_bits;
00597   _event_triggerBits=event_trigger_bits;
00598 
00599   // do not distinguish sub detector types:
00600   if(isGenSWTriggerOn() || isSWTriggerOn() || _triggerPollTimeout) {
00601     unsigned int smeared_trigger_word=getSmearedTriggerMainWord();
00602     // only assume that it is a software trigger if non of the enabled inputs has fired.
00603     if ( (smeared_trigger_word & getTrgConfigurationMask() & ~_genericTriggerMask) == 0) {
00604       _event_triggerBits.setPedestalTrigger();
00605     }
00606     else {
00607       std::cout << "Software trigger but conf=" << std::hex << getTrgConfigurationMask() << " and event=" << smeared_trigger_word << std::dec << std::endl;
00608     }
00609   }
00610   
00611   // \todo calibration pulse will be only there in a short time window 
00612   // so if the trigger main word is outside this window, there is probably
00613   // no calibration pulse.
00614   
00615   // btw. calib is not really a trigger
00616   // and it is switch on by every trigger also beam triggers 
00617   if(isCalibrationOn()) {
00618     _event_triggerBits.setCalibTrigger();
00619   }
00620   
00621   
00622   if (start_trigger_word< getUsedFifoDepth() ) {
00623     // now get the _distanceToPreTrigger (post history) of all configured trigger bits to the main word
00624     unsigned int new_trigger_mask=~event_trigger_bits;
00625     unsigned foundFirstOff(0);
00626     //bool updatetriggermask(false);
00627     for (unsigned int iword=start_trigger_word; iword-- > first_trigger_word; ) {
00628       
00629       unsigned int this_triggers=0;
00630       if ( _theTriggerFifoCont[iword] & _principleTriggerMask ) {
00631         
00632         for(TriggerDefinitionMap_t::const_iterator  trdef_iter = _trdefMap.begin(); 
00633             trdef_iter != _trdefMap.end(); 
00634             ++trdef_iter) {
00635           
00636           // the trigger is delayed but it may jittering to a shorter delay:
00637           //  iword < _this_trigger_main_word  + trdef_iter->first.delay() - trdef_iter->first.jitter()
00638           // To avoid a subtraction of unsigned :
00639           if ( iword +  trdef_iter->first.jitter() < static_cast<unsigned int>(_this_trigger_main_word)  + trdef_iter->first.delay() ) {
00640             //updatetriggermask=true;
00641             // build mask of all triggers which are on to mask them when looking at the next word.
00642             this_triggers |= _theTriggerFifoCont[iword] &  trdef_iter->first.mask();
00643 
00644             //In the next check only trigger bits 'survive' the 'if statement'
00645             //which were set in the mainword 
00646             if(!(foundFirstOff & trdef_iter->first.mask()) && (event_trigger_bits & trdef_iter->second.bitMask())) {
00647               //if(evt->getEventNumber() > 1000 &&
00648               // trdef_iter->first.mask() == 0x8000) {
00649               //std::cout << std::hex << "First cond: " << (_theTriggerFifoCont[iword] & trdef_iter->first.mask()) << std::endl; 
00650               //}
00651               //If the bit is still on continue to the next trigger bit
00652               if((_theTriggerFifoCont[iword] & trdef_iter->first.mask())) {
00653                 //This means that it has ever been on during our check
00654                 //So we declare this bit to be dirty
00655                 if (iword == first_trigger_word) dirty_triggerBits |= trdef_iter->second.bitMask();
00656                 continue;} else {
00657                   //ok this trigger was on in the main word but is now off 
00658                   //Check how often is has been on from iword+1 until
00659                   //the delay corrected main word taking the
00660                   //pulselength into account
00661                   unsigned int ion(0);
00662                   unsigned int iowords[pulselength];
00663                   //Attention need to sneak one into the post history
00664                   for(unsigned int icheck = iword+1; icheck < static_cast<unsigned int>(_this_trigger_main_word)+trdef_iter->first.delay()+pulselength; icheck++){
00665                     //count how often it was on
00666                     if(_theTriggerFifoCont[icheck] & trdef_iter->first.mask()) ion++;
00667                     if(ion-1 < pulselength) iowords[ion-1] = icheck; 
00668                     
00669                   }
00670                   //The bit was on more often than its pulslength
00671                   //This is already an indicator that something is wrong
00672                   if (ion > pulselength)  dirty_triggerBits |= trdef_iter->second.bitMask();
00673                   else { 
00674                     
00675                     //This is a bug (or a very strange situation) and has to be declared like that
00676                     //Well, this is a bug if we would with relative delays
00677                     /*if(ion == 0) { 
00678                       std::stringstream message;
00679                       message << "TriggerHandlerCalice::searchTriggerHistory> ";              
00680                       message << "PreTriggerHistorySearch doesn't find trigger Bit "; 
00681                       message << trdef_iter->second.name() ;
00682                       message << " although present in the main word???" << std::endl;
00683 #ifdef RECO_DEBUG
00684                       std::cout << "main word = " << _this_trigger_main_word << "  event= " << _event_triggerBits << " conf=" << _conf_triggerBits << std::endl;
00685                       int icount(0); 
00686                       for(IntVec::iterator vec_iter = _theTriggerFifoCont.begin();vec_iter != _theTriggerFifoCont.end(); vec_iter++){
00687                         std::cout << "Fifo Element at " <<  icount << " is: " << "in hex: " << std::hex << *vec_iter << std::dec << " in ";
00688                         to_binary_bitops(*vec_iter);  
00689                         
00690                         icount++;
00691                       }
00692 #endif
00693                       throw std::runtime_error(message.str());
00694                       }*/ 
00695                     //if its smaller or equal the pulslength
00696                     //check the distance between the words
00697                     //FIXME; the situation gets more complicated if the  
00698                     //pulslength is larger then two, in that case we'd
00699                     //need to check for consecutive pulses
00700                     if(ion > 0) {if( static_cast<unsigned
00701                                      int>(abs(static_cast<int>(iowords[0]-iowords[ion-1])))
00702                                      > pulselength)  dirty_triggerBits |=
00703                                                        trdef_iter->second.bitMask();}
00704                   }          
00705                   
00706                   
00707                 }
00708               //Here we have identify a trigger that is off for the
00709               //first time after the main word while present in the main word
00710               foundFirstOff |= trdef_iter->first.mask();  
00711               //Prevent further testing if this trigger bit is off for the first
00712               //time after the main word
00713               continue;
00714             } //end of check for bits in the main word
00715             
00716             //if(evt->getEventNumber() > 1000 && trdef_iter->first.mask()
00717             //== 0x8000) std::cout << "Spill trigger???" << iword << std::endl;
00718 
00719             if ( ( _theTriggerFifoCont[iword] & new_trigger_mask) &  trdef_iter->first.mask()) {
00720               
00721               // ignore the 
00722               int a_distance = _this_trigger_main_word - (iword - trdef_iter->first.delay() );
00723               if (a_distance>1 ) { 
00724                 
00725                 std::map<unsigned int,unsigned int>::iterator the_distance=_distanceToPreTrigger.find(a_distance);
00726                 if (the_distance == _distanceToPreTrigger.end()) {
00727                   _distanceToPreTrigger[a_distance] = trdef_iter->second.bitMask();
00728                 }
00729                 else {
00730                   the_distance->second |= trdef_iter->second.bitMask();
00731                 }
00732               }
00733             }
00734           }
00735         }
00736       }
00737       // mask all trigger which are on
00738       //if(updatetriggermask) new_trigger_mask = ~this_triggers;
00739       new_trigger_mask = ~this_triggers;
00740       
00741     }
00742   }
00743 
00744   //By construction the smallest distance filled into the distanceTo... is 2
00745   //so we use distance=1 for the results on bits which were on in the
00746   //main word  
00747   if(dirty_triggerBits) _distanceToPreTrigger[1] = dirty_triggerBits;
00748   dirty_triggerBits=0;
00749 
00750   //_distanceToPostTrigger.clear();
00751 
00752   if ( future_search_start_trigger_word > 0 && future_search_start_trigger_word < getUsedFifoDepth() ) {
00753 
00754   // now search for triggers which occured in the "future".
00755 
00756   unsigned int new_trigger_mask=~event_trigger_bits;
00757   //an unsigned in which we store whether we have found the first off for
00758   //this trigger
00759   unsigned foundFirstOff(0);
00760   for (unsigned int iword=future_search_start_trigger_word; iword < getUsedFifoDepth(); iword++ ) {
00761 
00762 
00763     unsigned int this_triggers=0;
00764     if ( _theTriggerFifoCont[iword] & _principleTriggerMask ) {
00765 
00766       for(TriggerDefinitionMap_t::const_iterator  trdef_iter = _trdefMap.begin(); 
00767           trdef_iter != _trdefMap.end(); 
00768           ++trdef_iter) {
00769 
00770         // the trigger is delayed but it may jitter to a smaller delay:
00771         //  iword < _this_trigger_main_word  + trdef_iter->first.delay() + trdef_iter->first.jitter()
00772         if ( iword  > static_cast<unsigned int>(_this_trigger_main_word)  + trdef_iter->first.delay() +  trdef_iter->first.jitter() ) {
00773 
00774           this_triggers |= _theTriggerFifoCont[iword] &  trdef_iter->first.mask();
00775 
00776           //In the next check only trigger bits 'survive' the 'if statement'
00777           //which were set in the mainword 
00778           if(!(foundFirstOff & trdef_iter->first.mask()) && (event_trigger_bits & trdef_iter->second.bitMask())) {
00779             //if(evt->getEventNumber() > 1000 &&
00780             //   trdef_iter->first.mask() == 0x8000) {
00781             //  std::cout << std::hex << "First cond: " << (_theTriggerFifoCont[iword] & trdef_iter->first.mask()) << std::endl; 
00782             //}
00783             //If the bit is still on continue to the next trigger bit
00784             if((_theTriggerFifoCont[iword] & trdef_iter->first.mask())) {
00785                 //This means that it has ever been on during our check
00786                 //So we declare this bit to be dirty
00787               if(iword==getUsedFifoDepth()-1) dirty_triggerBits |= trdef_iter->second.bitMask();
00788               continue;} else {
00789                 //ok this trigger was on in the main word but is now off 
00790                 //Check how often is has been on from iword-1 until
00791                 //the delay corrected main word taking the
00792                 //pulselength into account
00793                 unsigned int ion(0);
00794                 unsigned int iowords[pulselength];
00795                 //Here we need to check only up to the (delay corrected)
00796                 //main word since part of the range up to (corr.)
00797                 //mainword-pulslength is already covered by preHistorySearch
00798                 for(unsigned int icheck = iword-1; icheck > static_cast<unsigned int>(_this_trigger_main_word)
00799                       + trdef_iter->first.delay()-pulselength+1; icheck--){
00800                   //count how often it was on
00801                   if(_theTriggerFifoCont[icheck] & trdef_iter->first.mask()) ion++;
00802                   if(ion-1 < pulselength) iowords[ion-1] = icheck; 
00803                   
00804                 }
00805                 //The bit was on more often than its pulslength
00806                 //This is already an indicator that something is wrong
00807                 if (ion > pulselength)  dirty_triggerBits |= trdef_iter->second.bitMask();
00808                 else { 
00809                   
00810                   //This is a bug (or a very strange situation) and has to be declared like that
00811                   //Well, this is a bug if we would worl with realtive delays
00812                   /*if(ion == 0) { 
00813                     std::stringstream message;
00814                     message << "TriggerHandlerCalice::searchTriggerHistory> ";              
00815                     message << "PostTriggerHistorySearch doesn't find trigger Bit "; 
00816                     message << trdef_iter->second.name() ;
00817                     message << " although present in the main word???" << std::endl;
00818 #ifdef RECO_DEBUG
00819                     std::cout << "main word = " << _this_trigger_main_word << "  event= " << _event_triggerBits << " conf=" << _conf_triggerBits << std::endl;
00820                     int icount(0); 
00821                     for(IntVec::iterator vec_iter = _theTriggerFifoCont.begin();vec_iter != _theTriggerFifoCont.end(); vec_iter++){
00822                       std::cout << "Fifo Element at " <<  icount << " is: " << "in hex: " << std::hex << *vec_iter << std::dec << " in ";
00823                       to_binary_bitops(*vec_iter);  
00824                       
00825                       icount++;
00826                     }
00827 #endif
00828                     //throw std::runtime_error(message.str());
00829                     }*/ 
00830                   //if its smaller or equal the pulslength
00831                   //check the distance between the words
00832                   //FIXME; the situation gets more complicated if the  
00833                   //pulslength is larger then two, in that case we'd
00834                   //need to check for consecutive pulses
00835                   if( ion > 0) {if( static_cast<unsigned
00836                                     int>(abs(static_cast<int>(iowords[0]-iowords[ion-1])))
00837                                     > pulselength)  dirty_triggerBits |=
00838                                                       trdef_iter->second.bitMask();}
00839                 }          
00840                 
00841                 
00842               }
00843             //Here we have identify a trigger that is off for the
00844             //first time after the main word while present in the main word
00845             foundFirstOff |= trdef_iter->first.mask();  
00846             //Prevent further testing if this trigger bit is off for the first
00847             //time after the main word
00848             continue;
00849           } //end of check for bits in the main word
00850 
00851 
00852 
00853           if ( ( _theTriggerFifoCont[iword] & new_trigger_mask) &  trdef_iter->first.mask()) {
00854 
00855             unsigned int a_distance = (iword - trdef_iter->first.delay() ) - _this_trigger_main_word;
00856             if (a_distance>1) { 
00857 
00858               std::map<unsigned int,unsigned int>::iterator the_distance=_distanceToPostTrigger.find(a_distance);
00859               if (the_distance == _distanceToPostTrigger.end()) {
00860                 _distanceToPostTrigger[a_distance] = trdef_iter->second.bitMask();
00861               }
00862               else {
00863                 the_distance->second |= trdef_iter->second.bitMask();
00864               }
00865             }
00866           }
00867         }
00868       }
00869     }
00870     new_trigger_mask = ~this_triggers;
00871   }
00872   }
00873 
00874   //By construction the smallest distance filled into the distanceTo... is 2
00875   //so we use distance=1 for the results on bits which were on in the
00876   //main word  
00877   if(dirty_triggerBits) _distanceToPostTrigger[1] = dirty_triggerBits;
00878 
00879 
00880 #ifdef RECO_DEBUG
00881   std::cout << "main word = " << _this_trigger_main_word << "  event= " << _event_triggerBits << " conf=" << _conf_triggerBits << std::endl;
00882 
00883 
00884   for (unsigned int iword=0; iword < _theTriggerFifoCont.size(); iword++ ) {
00885 
00886     unsigned int bits=0;
00887     unsigned int value=_theTriggerFifoCont[iword];
00888     for(TriggerDefinitionMap_t::const_iterator  trdef_iter = _trdefMap.begin(); 
00889         trdef_iter != _trdefMap.end(); 
00890         ++trdef_iter) {
00891       if (value & trdef_iter->first.mask()) {
00892         bits |= trdef_iter->second.bitMask();
00893       }
00894       
00895     }
00896     if (bits ) {
00897       std::cout << setw(3) << iword << ":" << CALICE::TriggerBits(bits) << std::endl;
00898     }
00899   }
00900 
00901 
00902   std::cout << "pre trigger:" << std::endl;
00903   for (std::map<unsigned int, unsigned int>::const_iterator hist_iter=_distanceToPreTrigger.begin();
00904        hist_iter!=_distanceToPreTrigger.end();
00905        hist_iter++) {
00906     std::cout << setw(3) << static_cast<int>(hist_iter->first) << " " << TriggerBits(hist_iter->second) << std::endl;
00907   }
00908   std::cout << "post trigger:" << std::endl;
00909   for (std::map<unsigned int, unsigned int>::const_iterator hist_iter=_distanceToPostTrigger.begin();
00910        hist_iter!=_distanceToPostTrigger.end();
00911        hist_iter++) {
00912     std::cout << setw(3) << static_cast<int>(hist_iter->first) << " " << TriggerBits(hist_iter->second) << std::endl;
00913   }
00914   std::cout << endl;
00915 
00916 #endif  
00917   //return _distanceToPreTrigger;
00918   }
00919 
00920 void TriggerHandlerCalice::printTriggerDefinitions(const LCEvent* evt) {
00921 
00922 #ifdef TRIGGER_HANDLER_IS_SINGLETON
00923    //check whether the init method has already been called 
00924    //if not do it
00925    if(!_isInitialized) init();
00926 #endif
00927 
00928    LCTime theTime(evt->getTimeStamp());
00929 
00930    //print the trigger map
00931    
00932    TriggerDefinitionMap_t::iterator trdef_iter;
00933 
00934    std::cout << "******* Trigger Definition for Run: " << evt->getRunNumber() << " and Event: " << evt->getEventNumber() << " *********" << std::endl;   
00935    std::cout << "******* at Time: " << theTime.getDateString() << " *********" << std::endl;      
00936    //std::cout << "TriggerType         BitPosition" << std::endl; 
00937    std::cout << "TriggerType         TriggerMask     TriggerDelay    TriggerJitter" << std::endl; 
00938    std::cout << "-----------         -----------     ------------    -------------" << std::endl; 
00939    for(trdef_iter = _trdefMap.begin(); trdef_iter != _trdefMap.end(); ++trdef_iter) {
00940      std::cout << trdef_iter->second.name() << std::setw(20) << std::hex
00941                << trdef_iter->first.mask() << std::setw(20) 
00942      //        << std::endl;
00943      
00944      // knwon trigger definitions which will appear in the event header
00945      //if (trdef_iter->second.bitMask()!=0) {
00946      //  std::cout << " * ";
00947        //}
00948      // if standard trigger definition
00949      //     for (UInt_t type_i=0; type_i<kNTriggerTypes; type_i++) {
00950      //       if (trdef_iter->second.name() == _triggerNames[type_i]) {
00951      //  std::cout << " * ";
00952      //       }
00953      //     }
00954 
00955      << trdef_iter->first.delay() << std::setw(20) << trdef_iter->first.jitter() << std::endl; 
00956 
00957    }
00958    
00959    std::cout << "Principle Trigger Mask: " << std::hex << _principleTriggerMask << std::dec << std::endl;
00960 
00961    std::cout << "Generic Trigger Mask: " << std::hex << _genericTriggerMask << std::dec << std::endl;
00962   std::cout << "Configuration Mask: " << std::hex << _confTriggerMask << std::dec << std::endl;
00963 
00964 
00965 #ifdef BOUNDARY_CHECK
00966   assert ( _nFrontEnds.size() == _swTriggerOnVec.size() );
00967 #endif
00968 
00969   std::cout << "Individual Software Trigger: ";
00970   unsigned int sub_det_i=0;
00971   for (std::vector< unsigned int >::const_iterator sub_det_iter=_swTriggerOnVec.begin();
00972        sub_det_iter != _swTriggerOnVec.end();
00973        sub_det_iter++, sub_det_i++) {
00974     std::cout << sub_det_i << ":";
00975     if ( *sub_det_iter== _nFrontEnds[sub_det_i] ) {
00976       std::cout << "on ";
00977     }
00978     else {
00979       if ( *sub_det_iter==0 ) {
00980         std::cout << "off ";
00981       }
00982       else  {
00983         std::cout << "on=" << *sub_det_iter << "/" << _nFrontEnds[sub_det_i] << " ";
00984       }
00985     }
00986   }
00987 
00988   
00989   std::cout << " -> " << ( _swTriggerOnInd   ? "on " : "off ")  << std::endl;
00990 
00991 
00992   std::cout << "General Software Trigger: " << ( _swTriggerOnGen   ? "on " : "off ")  << std::endl; 
00993 
00994    std::cout << "Calibration : ";
00995   sub_det_i=0;
00996   for (std::vector<bool>::const_iterator sub_det_iter=_calibrationOnVec.begin();
00997        sub_det_iter != _calibrationOnVec.end();
00998        sub_det_iter++, sub_det_i++) {
00999     std::cout << sub_det_i << ":" << ( *sub_det_iter   ? "on " : "off ");
01000   }
01001   std::cout << "  -> " << ( _calibrationOn   ? "on " : "off ")  << std::endl;
01002 
01003 
01004   std::cout << "A software trigger will be regarded as a PEDESTAL Trigger and superseeds the definitions above!!! " << std::endl;
01005   std::cout << "--------------------------------------------------" << std::endl;
01006 
01007 
01008 }
01009 
01010 void TriggerHandlerCalice::TriggerConditionsListener(){
01011 
01012   //Do the check only in case there is a trigger definitions map and 
01013   //after the trigger configuration has been retrieved from the db
01014   if ( !_trdefMap.empty() && _nConfigurationChanges > 0) {
01015 
01016 
01017     if ( (_principleTriggerMask & _confTriggerMask) != _confTriggerMask ) {   
01018       std::stringstream message;
01019       message << "TriggerHandlerCalice TriggerConditions Listener: Trigger Configuration Requires non defined Trigger inputs:";
01020       unsigned int mask=1;
01021       //Get undefined bits
01022       unsigned int undefined = _confTriggerMask & (~_principleTriggerMask);
01023       for (unsigned int bit_i=0; bit_i<32; bit_i++) {
01024         if(undefined & mask) {
01025           message << bit_i << " ";
01026         }
01027         mask <<= 1;
01028       }
01029       std::cout << "Error Occured for Trigger Configuration No: " << _nConfigurationChanges  << std::endl;
01030       throw std::runtime_error ( message.str() ); 
01031     }
01032   }
01033   
01034 }
01035 
01036 void TriggerHandlerCalice::CreateTriggerDefinitionMap(EVENT::LCCollection *TrAssCol) {
01037 
01038   bool isObsoleteFormat(false);
01039   _trdefMap.clear();
01040 
01041 
01042   /*Get Trigger Types, delays and jitters from the collection
01043    The method checks whether an oblsolete format is accidentally accessed
01044    and raise a warning if so.
01045    This check you will find all over the place
01046   */
01047 
01048   if (!TrAssCol) throw std::runtime_error("TriggerHandlerCalice::CreateTriggerDefinitionMap - No Trigger Definition found. Will leave program now!!!");
01049 
01050   StringVec trigger_types;
01051   TrAssCol->getParameters().getStringVals(PAR_TRIGGER_TYPE_NAMES, trigger_types);
01052   //Check for the trigger types parameters under a different name
01053   //This parameter has been stored under a different name in older
01054   //Versions of the db!!!
01055   if(trigger_types.size() == 0) TrAssCol->getParameters().getStringVals("Trigger_Types", trigger_types);
01056   if(trigger_types.size() == 0) throw std::runtime_error("No Trigger Types defined. Will leave program now !!!");
01057 
01058   IntVec trigger_mask;
01059   IntVec trigger_delay;
01060   IntVec trigger_jitter;
01061 
01062   //Used to check for old/obsolete format
01063   IntVec trigger_value;
01064   IntVec trigger_position;
01065 
01066 
01067   TrAssCol->getParameters().getIntVals(PAR_TRIGGER_BITS, trigger_position);
01068   TrAssCol->getParameters().getIntVals(PAR_TRIGGER_VALUE, trigger_value);
01069 
01070   if(trigger_position.size() > 0 || trigger_value.size() > 0) {
01071     std::cout << "You have an obsolete version of the TriggerDefinition at hand" << std::endl;
01072     std::cout << "This version of the TriggerHandler needs: " << std::endl;  
01073     std::cout << "TriggerType TriggerMask TriggerDelay TriggerJitter" << std::endl;
01074     std::cout << "The TriggerAssignment at hand contains: " << std::endl;
01075     std::cout << "TriggerType TriggerMask(Position) TriggerValue " << std::endl;
01076     std::cout << "Will set defaults for Delay=0 and Jitter=1" << std::endl;
01077     isObsoleteFormat=true;
01078 #ifdef RECO_DEBUG
01079   cout << "Trigger Position size: " << trigger_position.size() << std::endl;
01080   cout << "Trigger Types size: " << trigger_types.size() << std::endl;
01081 #endif
01082    }
01083 
01084 
01085   TrAssCol->getParameters().getIntVals(PAR_TRIGGER_MASK, trigger_mask);
01086   TrAssCol->getParameters().getIntVals(PAR_TRIGGER_DELAY, trigger_delay);
01087   TrAssCol->getParameters().getIntVals(PAR_TRIGGER_JITTER, trigger_jitter);
01088 
01089   //This is really crazy and should never !!! happen
01090   if(isObsoleteFormat && ( trigger_delay.size() > 0 || trigger_jitter.size() > 0))
01091     {
01092     std::stringstream message;
01093     message << "The conditions data for the trigger assignment are utterly wrong." << std::endl
01094             << "Current Format and obsolete format mixed Will leave program now !!!"
01095             << "Trigger Types size: " << trigger_types.size() << std::endl
01096             << "Trigger Mask size: " << trigger_mask.size() << std::endl
01097             << "Trigger Delay size: " << trigger_delay.size() << std::endl
01098             << "Trigger jitter size: " << trigger_jitter.size() << std::endl
01099             << "Trigger Position size: " << trigger_position.size() << std::endl
01100             << "Trigger Value size: " << trigger_value.size() << std::endl;
01101                  throw std::runtime_error(message.str());
01102     }
01103 #ifdef RECO_DEBUG
01104   cout << "Trigger Mask size: " << trigger_mask.size() << std::endl;
01105   cout << "Trigger Delay size: " << trigger_delay.size() << std::endl;
01106   cout << "Trigger Jitter size: " << trigger_jitter.size() << std::endl;
01107 #endif
01108 
01109     //This is a real severe error !!! Here we need a dedicated error handling !!!
01110     if(trigger_position.size() > 0) {
01111       if( trigger_position.size() != trigger_types.size() ) 
01112         {
01113           cout << "Trigger Types size: " << trigger_types.size() << std::endl;
01114           cout << "Trigger Position size: " << trigger_position.size() << std::endl;
01115           throw std::runtime_error("The conditions data for the trigger assignment are utterly wrong. Will leave program now !!!");
01116         }
01117     }
01118     else {
01119       if( (trigger_mask.size()  != trigger_types.size() ) || 
01120           (trigger_mask.size() != trigger_types.size() ) ||
01121           (trigger_delay.size() > 0 && trigger_delay.size() != trigger_types.size() ) ||
01122           (trigger_jitter.size() > 0 && trigger_jitter.size() != trigger_types.size() ) ) {
01123         
01124         std::stringstream message;
01125         message << "The conditions data for the trigger assignment are utterly wrong. Will leave program now !!!"
01126                 << "Trigger Types size: " << trigger_types.size() << std::endl
01127                 << "Trigger Mask size: " << trigger_mask.size() << std::endl
01128                 << "Trigger Delay size: " << trigger_delay.size() << std::endl
01129                 << "Trigger jitter size: " << trigger_jitter.size() << std::endl;
01130         
01131         throw std::runtime_error(message.str());
01132         
01133       }
01134     }
01135 
01136    //We loop over one vector and access simultaneously the elements
01137    //of the other vectors. This is safe since we've 
01138   //checked that the 
01139    //all vectors are of equal size.
01140    StringVec::iterator trtyp_iter; 
01141    unsigned int itype = 0;
01142 
01143    //Initialize the trigger masks
01144    _principleTriggerMask = 0;   
01145    _genericTriggerMask = 0;   
01146 
01147    std::map<std::string, unsigned int>::const_iterator genericTriggerIter = _knownTrigger.find( CALICE::TriggerBits::getName(CALICE::TriggerBits::kGenericBit) );
01148    assert ( genericTriggerIter != _knownTrigger.end());
01149 
01150    for(trtyp_iter = trigger_types.begin(); trtyp_iter != trigger_types.end(); ++trtyp_iter){ 
01151 
01152 
01153 //Create the actual trigger map
01154 #ifdef RECO_DEBUG
01155      std::cout << "Trigger Type: " << *trtyp_iter << std::endl;
01156      if(trigger_position.size() > 0) {
01157        std::cout << "Trigger Position: " << std::hex << trigger_position.at(itype) << std::dec << std::endl;
01158      } else {
01159        std::cout << "Trigger Mask: " << std::hex << trigger_mask.at(itype) << std::endl;
01160      }
01161 #endif
01162 
01163      short delay=0;
01164      if (trigger_delay.size()>0) {
01165        delay=static_cast<short>(trigger_delay[itype]);
01166      }
01167 
01168      unsigned short jitter=1;
01169      if (trigger_jitter.size()>0) {
01170        jitter=static_cast<unsigned short>(trigger_jitter[itype]);
01171      }
01172 
01173      pair<TriggerDefinitionMap_t::iterator,bool > update_trmap; 
01174      if(trigger_position.size() > 0) {
01175        update_trmap = _trdefMap.insert( make_pair(TriggerValue_t(1 << trigger_position.at(itype),
01176                                                                  delay, jitter),
01177                                                   TriggerDef_t(*trtyp_iter)));
01178      } else {
01179        update_trmap = _trdefMap.insert( make_pair(TriggerValue_t(trigger_mask.at(itype), 
01180                                                                  delay,jitter), 
01181                                                   TriggerDef_t(*trtyp_iter) ) );
01182      }
01183 
01184      //This should never happen but anyway
01185      if(!update_trmap.second) {
01186        throw std::runtime_error ( "TriggerHandlerCalice CreateTriggerDefinitionMap: Creation of TriggerMap failed"); 
01187      }                      
01188 
01189      if (*trtyp_iter != "UNKNOWN") { 
01190 
01191        if(trigger_position.size() > 0 ) {
01192          _principleTriggerMask = _principleTriggerMask | ( 1 << trigger_position.at(itype));  
01193        } else {
01194          _principleTriggerMask = _principleTriggerMask | trigger_mask.at(itype);     
01195        }
01196 
01197      }
01198 
01199      if (*trtyp_iter == genericTriggerIter->first ) {
01200 
01201        if(trigger_position.size() > 0) {
01202          _genericTriggerMask = _genericTriggerMask | ( 1 << trigger_position.at(itype));  
01203        } else {
01204          _genericTriggerMask = _genericTriggerMask | trigger_mask.at(itype);  
01205        }
01206 
01207      }
01208      itype++;
01209    }
01210 
01211    // copy the trigger bits which will be set in the event header.
01212    unsigned int trigger_i = 0; 
01213    for (TriggerDefinitionMap_t::iterator trigger_type_iter=_trdefMap.begin();
01214         trigger_type_iter!=_trdefMap.end();
01215         trigger_type_iter++, trigger_i++) {
01216 
01217      std::cout << " TriggerType: " << trigger_type_iter->second.name() << std::endl; 
01218 
01219      std::map<std::string, unsigned int>::const_iterator known_trigger=_knownTrigger.find(trigger_type_iter->second.name());
01220      if (known_trigger!=_knownTrigger.end()) {
01221        trigger_type_iter->second.setBitMask(known_trigger->second);
01222        if (_verbose) {
01223          std::cout << "Trigger Mask  Assigned Bit(Offline)       Trigger Type" << std::endl;
01224          std::cout << std::hex << setw(9) << trigger_type_iter->first.mask()  
01225                    << " -> "   << setw(9) << known_trigger->second << " : " 
01226                    << setw(25) << trigger_type_iter->second.name() 
01227                    << std::dec << std::endl;
01228        }
01229      }
01230      else {
01231        std::stringstream message;
01232        message << "TriggerHandlerCalice::CreateTriggerDefinitionMap> Assignment of unknown trigger: " << trigger_type_iter->second.name();
01233        throw std::runtime_error(message.str());
01234      }
01235 
01236    }
01237 
01238   updateTriggerConfBits();
01239   TriggerConditionsListener();
01240 
01241 }
01242 
01243 void TriggerHandlerCalice::ExtractTriggerEnvironment(EVENT::LCCollection *confCol) {
01244 
01245 
01246   //initialize the Configuration Mask
01247   _confTriggerMask = 0;
01248   //..and the anad Enable word  
01249   _andEnable0 = 0;
01250 
01251   //Analyze coniguration words 
01252   int num_elmnts = confCol->getNumberOfElements() ; 
01253 
01254 
01255   //CRP Patch define a vector which contains written boardids
01256   std::vector<int> vec_board_id;
01257   vec_board_id.resize(0);
01258 
01259   //if there is only one element in the collection we take
01260   //what we get
01261   if (num_elmnts == 1) { 
01262      BeTrgConf beTrgConf(confCol->getElementAt(0));
01263     _confTriggerMask = beTrgConf.getInputEnableMask(); 
01264   }
01265 
01266 
01267   //Check first non-zero element with 'read' label
01268   //and assume that this contains the configured trigger(s)
01269   //If no entry matches we assume that a software trigger was configured
01270   //TODO: Check whether this is the right strategy
01271   if (num_elmnts > 1) {
01272 #ifdef RECO_DEBUG
01273     std::cout << "Info: TriggerHandlerCalice - ExtractTriggerEnvironment " << std::endl;
01274     std::cout << "More than one element in TriggerConfiguration Collection " << std::endl;
01275     std::cout << "Will use first non-zero Element with 'read' RecordLabel" << std::endl;
01276    std::cout << "In addition we check that the board was also written" << std::endl;
01277     std::cout << "Otherwise will set configuration to 0, i.e. Software Trigger" << std::endl;
01278 #endif
01279     for (int iconf = 0; iconf < confCol->getNumberOfElements(); iconf++)
01280       {
01281         BeTrgConf beTrgConf(confCol->getElementAt(iconf));
01282 #ifdef RECO_DEBUG
01283         cout << "BoardID: " << std::hex << beTrgConf.getBoardID() << std::dec << std::endl; 
01284         cout << "_confTriggerMask: " << iconf << ", " << std::hex << beTrgConf.getInputEnableMask() << std::dec << std::endl; 
01285         cout << "RecordLabel: " << beTrgConf.getRecordLabel() << std::endl; 
01286 #endif
01287         if(beTrgConf.getRecordLabel() == 1 && beTrgConf.getInputEnableMask() != 0) vec_board_id.push_back(beTrgConf.getBoardID());
01288         if (beTrgConf.getInputEnableMask() != 0 && beTrgConf.getRecordLabel() == 0 )  { 
01289           //As a patch we check whether this value appears also
01290           //in the written data (i.e. RecordLabel= 1)
01291           //All this is a coplete mess but anyway ... 
01292           //This strategy assumes that only one board get BeTrgconf
01293   //data input
01294   //This strategy has to be revised but works for the time being
01295           if (vec_board_id.size() == 1) {  
01296 
01297               if(vec_board_id.at(0) == beTrgConf.getBoardID()) {
01298                 _confTriggerMask = beTrgConf.getInputEnableMask();
01299                 _andEnable0 = beTrgConf.getAndEnable(0);
01300                 std::cout << "And Enable COnd:" << _andEnable0 << std::endl;
01301               } else {
01302                 std::cerr << "Warning, different boards for write (" << beTrgConf.getBoardID() << ") and read " << vec_board_id.at(0) << std::endl; 
01303               }
01304 
01305           } else {
01306             std::cerr << "Warning more than one board contains" << std::endl;
01307             std::cerr << " (written) BeTrgConfdata. Will take first board which appears" << std::endl;
01308             std::cerr << " in board vector" << std::endl;
01309 
01310           }
01311                 
01312 
01313         }
01314 
01315       }
01316 
01317   }
01318   if (_verbose) {
01319     std::cout << "Trigger configuration  " << _nConfigurationChanges << " enabled bits:";
01320     unsigned int mask=1;
01321     for (unsigned int bit_i=0; bit_i<32; bit_i++) {
01322       if(_confTriggerMask & mask) {
01323         std::cout << bit_i << " ";
01324       }
01325       mask <<= 1;
01326     }
01327     std::cout <<std::endl;
01328 
01329       
01330   }
01331   //Count configuration Changes
01332   _nConfigurationChanges++;
01333 
01334   //Tell the world about the great things we have found
01335 #ifdef RECO_DEBUG
01336   std::cout << "TriggerHandlerCalice::ExtractTriggerEnvironment Change No.: " << _nConfigurationChanges << std::endl;
01337   std::cout << "TriggerHandlerCalice::ExtractTriggerEnvironment ConfigTriggerMask: " << std::hex <<  _confTriggerMask << std::dec << std::endl;
01338 #endif
01339   updateTriggerConfBits();
01340   TriggerConditionsListener();
01341 
01342 }
01343 
01344 
01345   // set the predefined trigger bits (TriggerBits) according to the current configuration. 
01346   void TriggerHandlerCalice::updateTriggerConfBits()
01347   {
01348 
01349     //Set the bits enabled for coincidence
01350     unsigned int andenable_trigger_bits(0);
01351     
01352     for(TriggerDefinitionMap_t::const_iterator trdef_iter = _trdefMap.begin(); trdef_iter != _trdefMap.end(); ++trdef_iter) {
01353       if ( (_andEnable0 & trdef_iter->first.mask()) ) {  
01354         andenable_trigger_bits |= trdef_iter->second.bitMask();
01355       }
01356     }
01357     
01358     
01359     _andenable_triggerBits=CALICE::TriggerBits(andenable_trigger_bits);
01360 
01361 
01362 
01363     unsigned int conf_trigger_bits=0;
01364     
01365     for(TriggerDefinitionMap_t::const_iterator trdef_iter = _trdefMap.begin(); trdef_iter != _trdefMap.end(); ++trdef_iter) {
01366       if ( (_confTriggerMask & trdef_iter->first.mask()) ) {  
01367         conf_trigger_bits |= trdef_iter->second.bitMask();
01368       }
01369     }
01370     
01371     
01372     _conf_triggerBits=CALICE::TriggerBits(conf_trigger_bits);
01373     
01374     if (_swTriggerOnInd) {
01375       _conf_triggerBits.setPedestalTrigger();
01376     }
01377     else if (_confTriggerMask == 0 ) {
01378 
01379       // does this happen ? No input enabled, no visible software trigger configuration ? 
01380       // yes this can happen: assert ( false );
01381       // but is pedestal trigger correct ?
01382       _conf_triggerBits.setPedestalTrigger();
01383     }
01384     
01385     if (_calibrationOn) {
01386       _conf_triggerBits.setCalibTrigger();
01387     }
01388     
01389     if (_verbose) {
01390       std::cout << "Trigger configuration bits:" << _conf_triggerBits << std::endl;
01391     }
01392   }
01393 
01394 void TriggerHandlerCalice::feConfigurationChange(EVENT::LCCollection *feConfCol, unsigned int set_i) {
01395 #ifdef BOUNDARY_CHECK
01396   assert(set_i < _feConfCol.size());
01397 #endif
01398   _feConfCol[set_i]=feConfCol;
01399 
01400   checkForCalibrationOn();
01401 }
01402 
01403 
01404 // Verify whether the calibration chip is switched on
01405 //
01406 // Logic: loop over all connected FE. Set for each front end the calibration chip
01407 // change status and wehther it was turned on or off. This is done per sub detector
01408 // i.e. all FE conntect to one sub detector will toggle the calibration status of
01409 // the sub detector.
01410 // At the end, loop over all sub detectors find out whether the calibration chip
01411 // was changed if so set the new chip status for the sub detector. If the 
01412 // calibration is on for one sub detector set the global "calibration on" flag.
01413 
01414 bool TriggerHandlerCalice::checkForCalibrationOn()
01415 {
01416   std::vector<unsigned int > calib_change;
01417   // Set the calibration status as unchanged and to "off"
01418   calib_change.resize(_feConfCol.size(),0);
01419 
01420   // loop over all connected FE and set calibration status of the connected sub detector to
01421   // changed and if the calibration chip is on to "on"
01422   for (std::vector<LCCollection *>::const_iterator fe_col_iter=_feConfCol.begin();
01423        fe_col_iter != _feConfCol.end();
01424        fe_col_iter++) {
01425     if (*fe_col_iter) {
01426       //_feConfCol=col;
01427       
01428       for (UInt_t fe_i=0; fe_i<static_cast<UInt_t>((*fe_col_iter)->getNumberOfElements()); fe_i++) {
01429         CALICE::FeConfigurationBlock a_fe_conf((*fe_col_iter)->getElementAt(fe_i));
01430         CALICE::BoardID board_id(a_fe_conf.getBoardID());
01431 
01432         CrateList_t::const_iterator a_crate_iter=_connections.find(board_id.getCrateID());
01433 
01434         if (   a_crate_iter==_connections.end() 
01435             || static_cast<unsigned int>(board_id.getSlotID()) >= a_crate_iter->second.slotList().size() 
01436             || static_cast<unsigned int>(board_id.getBoardComponentNumber()) >= a_crate_iter->second.slotList()[board_id.getSlotID()].size() ) continue;
01437 
01438         unsigned int sub_det_i=a_crate_iter->second.slotList()[board_id.getSlotID()][board_id.getBoardComponentNumber()];
01439         if (sub_det_i >=   _calibrationOnVec.size() ) continue;
01440 
01441         calib_change[sub_det_i] |= 2;
01442         if (a_fe_conf.isCalibEnable()) {
01443           calib_change[sub_det_i] |= 1;
01444         }
01445 
01446       }
01447     }
01448   }
01449 
01450   // If the calibration status of a sub detector was changed update the status of the calibration 
01451   // chip for the sub detector.
01452   // Also set the global calibration flag
01453   _calibrationOn=false;
01454   for (unsigned int sub_det_i=0; sub_det_i<_calibrationOnVec.size(); sub_det_i++) {
01455     if (calib_change[sub_det_i] & 2) {
01456       _calibrationOnVec[sub_det_i]=(calib_change[sub_det_i] & 1);
01457       if (calib_change[sub_det_i] & 1) {
01458         _calibrationOn=true;
01459       }
01460     }
01461   }
01462 
01463   // print out the result
01464   if (_verbose) {
01465     
01466     std::cout << "Front end configuration:  calib " ;
01467     if (_calibrationOn) {
01468       std::cout << "on for sub dectors:";
01469       for (unsigned int sub_det_i=0; sub_det_i<_calibrationOnVec.size(); sub_det_i++) {
01470         if (_calibrationOnVec[sub_det_i]) {
01471           std::cout << sub_det_i << " ";
01472         }
01473       }
01474     }
01475     else {
01476       std::cout << " off.";
01477     }
01478     std::cout <<std::endl;
01479 
01480       
01481   }
01482 
01483   // Finally update the configuration bits;
01484 
01485   // clear bit in trigger configuration
01486   _conf_triggerBits=CALICE::TriggerBits(_conf_triggerBits.getTriggerBits() & ~CALICE::TriggerBits::kCalib);
01487 
01488   if (_calibrationOn) {
01489     _conf_triggerBits.setCalibTrigger();
01490   }
01491 
01492   return _calibrationOn;
01493 
01494 }
01495 
01496 void TriggerHandlerCalice::readoutConfChange(EVENT::LCCollection *roConfCol) {
01497   _roConfCol=roConfCol;
01498   checkForSoftwareTriggerOn();
01499 }
01500 
01501 
01502 // Check for software front-end or back-end triggers
01503 //
01504 // logic:
01505 // Consider only readout configuration data of connected crates.
01506 // If the back-end software trigger of one crate is set,  update the software
01507 // trigger status of all the sub detector which are connected to the crate.
01508 // Proceed in a similar way with the front-end software triggers. 
01509 // If the front-end trigger is configured, then change the software
01510 // trigger status of all sub detectors which are connected to a front-end
01511 // in any of the slots which has the same front-end ID.
01512 // If the software trigger is enabled for one sub detector then the
01513 // global flag is set to on.
01514 
01515 bool TriggerHandlerCalice::checkForSoftwareTriggerOn()
01516 {
01517 #ifdef RECO_DEBUG
01518   cout << "In ExtractSoftTrigConf: " << endl;
01519 #endif
01520 
01521   _swTriggerOnInd = false;
01522 
01523   for (std::vector< unsigned int >::iterator soft_trigger_iter= _swTriggerOnVec.begin();
01524        soft_trigger_iter != _swTriggerOnVec.end();
01525        soft_trigger_iter++ ) {
01526     *soft_trigger_iter=0;
01527   }
01528 
01529   //We will check only for be softtriggers 
01530   //This might be too naive and the checks performed here need to 
01531   //be much more complicated
01532 
01533   if(_roConfCol) {
01534     //If we find at least one crate with be s/w Trigger enabled we
01535     //declare s/w trigger to be on 
01536     // loop of readout elements 
01537 
01538     for (UInt_t ro_i=0; ro_i<static_cast<UInt_t>(_roConfCol->getNumberOfElements()); ro_i++) {
01539       CALICE::ReadOutConfigurationBlock ro_conf(_roConfCol->getElementAt(ro_i));
01540 
01541       //Check for be softtriggers  
01542 #ifdef CONV_DEBUG
01543       std::cout << "ro_i: " << ro_i << std::endl;
01544       std::cout << "SoftTriggerWord: " <<  ro_conf.getBeSoftTrigger() << std::endl;
01545 #endif
01546 
01547       unsigned int crate_id  = static_cast<UInt_t>(ro_conf.getCrateID());
01548       CrateList_t::const_iterator crate_iter = _connections.find(crate_id);
01549       
01550       // do not bother with unconnected crates
01551       if ( crate_iter == _connections.end())  continue;
01552 
01553       // back-end soft triggers
01554       if ( ro_conf.getBeSoftTrigger() ) {
01555         _swTriggerOnInd = true; 
01556         for (UInt_t sub_det_i=0; sub_det_i<_swTriggerOnVec.size(); sub_det_i++) {
01557           if (crate_iter->second.isConnectedToSubDetector(sub_det_i)) {
01558             _swTriggerOnVec[sub_det_i]++;
01559           }
01560         }
01561       }
01562 
01563       // front-end soft triggers
01564       for (UInt_t fe_i=0; fe_i<8; fe_i++) {
01565         if (ro_conf.getFeSoftTrigger(fe_i)) {
01566           for (UInt_t slot_i=ro_conf.getFirstSlot(); slot_i<=ro_conf.getLastSlot(); slot_i++) {
01567 
01568             if (ro_conf.isFeEnabled(slot_i,fe_i)) {
01569 
01570               // do not bother with unconnected front-ends
01571               if (crate_iter->second.slotList().size()<=slot_i || crate_iter->second.slotList()[slot_i].size()<=fe_i) continue;
01572               
01573               unsigned int sub_det_i=crate_iter->second.slotList()[slot_i][fe_i];
01574               if (sub_det_i<_swTriggerOnVec.size()) {
01575                 _swTriggerOnVec[sub_det_i]=true;
01576               }
01577               break;
01578             }
01579           }
01580         }
01581 
01582       }
01583 
01584     }
01585     
01586 
01587     bool mixed=false;
01588     unsigned int sub_det_i=0;
01589     for (vector<unsigned int >::const_iterator soft_trigger_iter= _swTriggerOnVec.begin();
01590          soft_trigger_iter != _swTriggerOnVec.end();
01591          soft_trigger_iter++,sub_det_i++ ) {
01592       if (*soft_trigger_iter>0) _swTriggerOnInd=true;
01593       if (    (*soft_trigger_iter>0) !=  _swTriggerOnInd 
01594            || (*soft_trigger_iter>0 &&  *soft_trigger_iter!=_nFrontEnds[sub_det_i] ) ) {
01595         mixed=true;
01596         break;
01597       }
01598     }
01599     
01600     // produce warning if soft trigger is configured differently for the different sub detectors.
01601     if (mixed) {
01602 
01603       UInt_t sub_det_i=0;
01604       std::cerr << "TriggerHandlerCalice::ExtractSoftTrigConf> WARNING soft trigger not the same for all sub detectors : ";
01605       for (vector<unsigned int >::const_iterator soft_trigger_iter= _swTriggerOnVec.begin();
01606            soft_trigger_iter != _swTriggerOnVec.end();
01607            soft_trigger_iter++, sub_det_i++ ) {
01608         std::cerr << sub_det_i;
01609         if ( *soft_trigger_iter==_nFrontEnds[sub_det_i]) std::cerr << ":on ";
01610         else if ( *soft_trigger_iter==0) std::cerr << ":off ";
01611         else std::cerr << ":" << *soft_trigger_iter << "/" << _nFrontEnds[sub_det_i] << "on";
01612       }
01613       std::cerr << std::endl;
01614 
01615     }
01616 
01617   }
01618   
01619   if (_verbose) {
01620     std::cout << "Individual Software trigger";
01621     if (_swTriggerOnInd) {
01622       std::cout << " on for sub detectors: ";
01623       unsigned int sub_det_i=0;
01624       for (vector<unsigned int >::const_iterator soft_trigger_iter= _swTriggerOnVec.begin();
01625            soft_trigger_iter != _swTriggerOnVec.end();
01626            soft_trigger_iter++, sub_det_i++ ) {
01627         if (*soft_trigger_iter) {
01628           std::cout << sub_det_i << " ";
01629         }
01630       }
01631     }
01632     else {
01633       std::cout << " off ";
01634     }
01635     std::cout << std::endl;
01636   }
01637 
01638   updateTriggerConfBits();
01639 
01640   return _swTriggerOnInd;
01641 }
01642 
01643 
01644 // Rebuild connection tree for the corresponding sub detector.
01645 // Keep the connection tree of the other sub detectors untouched.
01646 
01647 void TriggerHandlerCalice::moduleConnectionChange(EVENT::LCCollection *module_connection_col, unsigned int set_i)
01648 {
01649 #ifdef RECO_DEBUG
01650   std::cout << "Do module connection collections exist? " << module_connection_col << std::endl;
01651 #endif
01652 
01653   if (!module_connection_col) return;
01654 
01655 #ifdef BOUNDARY_CHECK
01656   assert(set_i < _nFrontEnds.size());
01657 
01658   // paranoia
01659   //  assert(_calibrationOnVec.size() == _connections.size());
01660 #endif
01661 
01662   _nFrontEnds[set_i]=0;
01663 
01664   // remove all connections for this sub_detector
01665 
01666   // FIXME: empty crates will stay forever in the connection tree. 
01667   //        But this is probably a case which will never occure
01668 
01669   // DEBUG: std::cout << " before removal:" << std::endl;
01670   // DEBUG printConnections(); 
01671 
01672   for (CrateList_t::iterator crate_iter=_connections.begin();
01673        crate_iter != _connections.end();
01674        crate_iter++ ) {
01675       
01676       for (SlotList_t::iterator slot_iter = crate_iter->second.slotList().begin();
01677            slot_iter != crate_iter->second.slotList().end();
01678            slot_iter++ ) {
01679           for (FrontEndList_t::iterator fe_iter = slot_iter->begin();
01680                fe_iter != slot_iter->end();
01681                fe_iter++) {
01682             if (*fe_iter==set_i) {
01683               *fe_iter=UINT_MAX; 
01684             }
01685           }
01686       }
01687   }
01688   
01689   // DBEUG: std::cout << " after removal:" << std::endl;
01690   // DEBUG: printConnections(); 
01691 
01692   const unsigned int max_n_slots=22;
01693   const unsigned int max_n_fe   =8;
01694 
01695   for (UInt_t element_i=0; element_i<static_cast<unsigned int>(module_connection_col->getNumberOfElements()); element_i++) {
01696     CALICE::ModuleConnection a_connection(module_connection_col->getElementAt(element_i));
01697 
01698     // ignore unexisting slots, front-ends
01699     if (static_cast<unsigned int>(a_connection.getSlot())>=max_n_slots) continue;
01700     if (static_cast<unsigned int>(a_connection.getFrontEnd())>=max_n_fe) continue;
01701 
01702     CrateList_t::iterator a_crate_iter=_connections.find(a_connection.getCrate());
01703     if (a_crate_iter == _connections.end()) {
01704       pair<CrateList_t::iterator, bool> res=_connections.insert(make_pair(static_cast<unsigned int>(a_connection.getCrate()), Crate_t(set_i)));
01705 
01706       if (!res.second) {
01707         throw std::runtime_error("TriggerHandlerCalice::moduleConnectionChanged>ERROR failed to insert front-end connection.");
01708       }
01709 
01710       a_crate_iter = res.first;
01711     }
01712 
01713     Crate_t &a_crate=a_crate_iter->second;
01714     a_crate.setSubDetectorID(set_i);
01715 
01716     if (a_crate.slotList().size() <= static_cast<unsigned int>(a_connection.getSlot())) {
01717       UInt_t old_size=a_crate.slotList().size();
01718       a_crate.slotList().resize(max_n_slots);
01719       UInt_t new_size=a_crate.slotList().size();
01720       for (UInt_t slot_i=old_size; slot_i<new_size; slot_i++) {
01721         // initialise elements with non-existing set id
01722         a_crate.slotList()[slot_i].resize(max_n_fe,UINT_MAX);
01723       }
01724     }
01725 
01726 #ifdef BOUNDARY_CHECK
01727     assert ( static_cast<unsigned int>(a_connection.getSlot()) < a_crate.slotList().size() );
01728     assert ( static_cast<unsigned int>(a_connection.getFrontEnd()) < a_crate.slotList()[a_connection.getSlot()].size() );
01729 #endif
01730 
01731     a_crate.slotList()[a_connection.getSlot()][a_connection.getFrontEnd()]=set_i;
01732     _nFrontEnds[set_i]++;
01733   }
01734 
01735   printConnections();
01736 
01737   checkForCalibrationOn();
01738   checkForSoftwareTriggerOn();
01739 }
01740 
01741 
01742 // debug method to verify that the connection tree is correctly build up
01743 //
01744 void TriggerHandlerCalice::printConnections()
01745 {
01746   for (CrateList_t::const_iterator crate_iter=_connections.begin();
01747        crate_iter != _connections.end();
01748        crate_iter++ ) {
01749     /* if (crate_iter->second.slotList().size()>0) */ {
01750       std::cout << "crate = " << std::hex << std::setw(4) << crate_iter->first << std::dec << " : " <<std::endl;
01751       
01752       unsigned int  slot_i=0;
01753       for (SlotList_t::const_iterator slot_iter = crate_iter->second.slotList().begin();
01754            slot_iter != crate_iter->second.slotList().end();
01755            slot_iter++, slot_i++ ) {
01756         
01757           UInt_t fe_i=0;
01758           for (FrontEndList_t::const_iterator fe_iter = slot_iter->begin();
01759                fe_iter != slot_iter->end();
01760                fe_iter++, fe_i++) {
01761             if (*fe_iter != UINT_MAX) break;
01762           }
01763           if (fe_i==8) continue;
01764         /* if (slot_iter->size() > 0 )*/ {
01765           std::cout << "slot " << std::setw(3) << slot_i  << " : " ;
01766           fe_i=0;
01767           for (FrontEndList_t::const_iterator fe_iter = slot_iter->begin();
01768                fe_iter != slot_iter->end();
01769                fe_iter++, fe_i++) {
01770             if (*fe_iter != UINT_MAX) {
01771               std::cout << std::setw(3) << fe_i << ":" << std::setw(2) << *fe_iter;
01772             }
01773           }
01774           std::cout << std::endl;
01775         }
01776       }
01777       std::cout << std::endl;
01778     }
01779   }
01780 }

01782   void TriggerHandlerCalice::ExtractGenSoftTrigConfiguration(EVENT::LCCollection *trgroConfCol) {
01783     
01784 #ifdef RECO_DEBUG
01785     cout << "In ExtractGenSoftTrigConf: " << endl;
01786 #endif
01787     
01788     _swTriggerOnGen = false;
01789 
01790     //We will check only for be softtriggers 
01791     //This might be too naive and the checks performed here need to 
01792     //be much more complicated
01793     
01794     if(trgroConfCol) {
01795       if(trgroConfCol->getNumberOfElements() != 1) {
01796         std::cout << "TriggerHandlerCalice -Warning: TrgReadconfiguration collection size > 1" << std::endl;
01797         std::cout << "Will use first element: " << std::endl;
01798         } 
01799   
01800         CALICE::TrgReadoutConfigurationBlock trgro_conf(trgroConfCol->getElementAt(0));
01801         //Check for general softtriggers  
01802 #ifdef RECO_DEBUG
01803         std::cout << "SoftTriggerWord: " <<  trgro_conf.getBeTrgSoftTrg() << std::endl;
01804 #endif
01805         if ( trgro_conf.getBeTrgSoftTrg() ) _swTriggerOnGen = true; 
01806 
01807     }
01808   }
